Build 20020402:
If just checked my .log file and have noticed about 5 of these exceptions:

==========================================================================

4 org.eclipse.debug.ui 120 Error logged from Debug UI: 
java.io.IOException
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.StreamsProxy.write(StreamsProxy.java:92)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.ConsoleDocument.fireDocumentChanged(ConsoleDocument.java(Compiled
Code))

	at

	at

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java(Compiled Code))
	at
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java(Compiled
Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:738)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:777)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:319)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:190)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:549)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:390)

See bug 6321.  I believe this is a case of error reporting being a little to 
zealous.

Fixed in ConsoleDocument. The fireDebugEvent was being used to gather user 
input and write it to the std in of a running process. I moved the logic 
to "replace(....)" as that is where we know the user has written input (rather 
than in fireDebugEvent, which is called from several places).

The fireDebugEvent was trying to guard against non-user input, but could fail 
if 1 char is written to the document by an output stream.
